data.title: Galton Valley Primary School
data.text:
Mr. J. Uddin

Parent Governor

My name is Jalal Uddin. I became a parent governor in2010 as I always wanted to contribute towards the development of my local community as well as being a part of shaping the future of our next generations. My two children both Jabir (8years old) and Jannah (5years old) go to GVPS- and I am really proud to be a part of their learning & development journey.

I have always been a great admirer of ‘education’. Previously, I served as a local authority governor at another school in Sandwell over the past years. Currently, I am a Governor of Sandwell College too.

Professionally, I work as a manager at Community Connect Foundation (CCF) that provides a range of services including providing education and skills development training opportunities for young people and adults. I am also a Chartered Marketer and a member of Chartered Institute of Marketing (CIM).

I strongly believe, these are really exciting times to be at GVPS. We, ‘the school community’ are determined not only to be outstanding in all we do, but also to develop and sustain a unique learning culture that makes being part of the school an engaging and challenging experience for all our pupils.

At GVPS, we are on a mission to create something really special – an inclusive and cooperative school with exceptional standards that is rooted in its local community.

Mrs. S. O'Boyle

Staff Governor

I have been Head Teacher of Galton Valley Primary School since 2012, and have been teaching since 1994 and a senior leader since 2005. I have been a governor since 2005 and a governor of Galton Valley from this 2012. This is the seventh school I have worked in across my career, but my first as Head Teacher. I am genuinely very proud and honoured to be Head Teacher of our brilliant school with amazing children, staff, parents and governors! We have exceptional children who work hard to do their best to make progress, alongside being polite, respectful and well-behaved. Of course, all of this happens down to the high expectations by school staff and supportive parents and families. We have a fabulous team of staff who work tirelessly to secure the very best for our children. It warms my heart to hear visitors comment on the friendly and warm welcome they receive when they visit our school. Our families are wonderful to work with as they are supportive and caring, wanting their children to face any challenges with resilience in order to become independent learners of the future.

Galton Valley Primary School also sits within a great community who offer support and are proud of their local school. We are lucky to have a steady governing body where individuals with various, relevant experience provide their support and challenge in their own free time. As a school, we are grateful for this support and challenge which is allowing us to move forward and strengthen further as a school.

Mrs. K. Whiting

LA Governor & Vice Chair.

I have been a Governor at Galton Valley Primary School for many years now and I am proud of the staff and pupils and the amazing work they do.

I am a Local Authority governor and currently the Vice Chair of Governors. I am the Chair of the resources committee and pay committee I am also one of the appraisers for the Head Teacher. My special responsibilities include: English and training.

Professionally I work for a local not for profit education support services company as the Strategic Director for People and Product. I am also a Board Director at The Westminster Specialist College and I am a Lay member for the Lord Chancellor’s Advisory Committee for West Midlands and Warwickshire

I am incredibly proud to be a Governor at Galton Valley and delighted to be a part of the team supporting our school philosophy to encourage children to have independency, enthusiasm for work and a sense of responsibility.

Mrs N Aktar

Parent Governor

I have been a Parent Governor at Galton Valley Primary School since 2015. currently I am the H & S Governor and Thematic Governor.

I bring my experience working within Real Estate Management, to enable children to have a safe learning environment. I am also part of the Resources committee, working closely with the Head Teacher and other stakeholders to ensure quality consistent teaching is delivered at the school, at the best value.

S Lagaha

SEND Governor

I have been a governor at Galton Valley since 2018, and have since adopted the role of SEND Governor and Staff Well-being Governor. I also work in CAMHS as a Children’s Psychological Well-being Practitioner, and I use my experience to ensure I promote positive emotional well-being and mental health outcomes for all children at Galton Valley.

Mrs C Robb

Staff Governor​​​​​​

Outcomes Committee and Governor for Computing and Science
